name: $resourceType
desc: Returns the FHIR type name for this instance

name: $::type
desc: Returns: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.

name: $addtype
desc: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.

lvardefs.name: objRef
lvardefs.desc: An indication of the reason that the entity signed this document. This may be explicitly included as part of the signature information and can be used when determining accountability for various actions concerning the document.

name: $when
desc: Returns: When the digital signature was signed.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: When the digital signature was signed.

name: $who
desc: Returns: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that signed  (e.g. the signature used their private key).

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that signed  (e.g. the signature used their private key).

name: $onBehalfOf
desc: Returns: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that is represented by the signature.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A reference to an application-usable description of the identity that is represented by the signature.

name: $targetFormat
desc: Returns: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the target resources signed by the signature.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the target resources signed by the signature.

name: $sigFormat
desc: Returns: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the signature. Important mime types are application/signature+xml for X ML DigSig, application/jose for JWS, and image/* for a graphical image of a signature, etc.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: A mime type that indicates the technical format of the signature. Important mime types are application/signature+xml for X ML DigSig, application/jose for JWS, and image/* for a graphical image of a signature, etc.

name: $data
desc: Returns: The base64 encoding of the Signature content. When signature is not recorded electronically this element would be empty.

pvardefs.name: pValue
pvardefs.desc: The base64 encoding of the Signature content. When signature is not recorded electronically this element would be empty.
